CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 9, 1952, pg. 16, reads: "UNIVERSITY OF PITTSBURGH MID-YEAR COMMENCEMENT - Eighteen Negroes were among the 506 awarded degrees at commencement exercises at Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall last Friday afternoon. Dr. Carter Davidson, president of Union COllege, gave the commencement address.  Two Negro educators were granted doctorates.  They were Inabel Burns Lindsay, dean of the School of Social Work at Howard University, and Donald Anderson Edwards, assistant professor of physics at Lincoln University, who completed his work for the degree of Doctor of Philosophy.  Dr. Lindsay and Fletcher L. White who earned a Bachelor of Science degree in education, and missing from the photos...In the center bottom photo, are left to right: James E. Caldwell, who received his Bachelor of Arts degree from the college and was also commissioned a second lieutenant in Quartermaster Corps; Sylvester Hargrave, who received his Bachelor of Arts degree from the Pre-Dental School; Charles N. Collins, and James W. Adkins.  Both of the latter were bacteriology majors and earned Bachelor of Science degrees. - All Photos by Harris."
TitMainTitle: James E. Caldwell, Sylvester Hargrave, Charles N. Collins, and James W. Adkins, recipients of Bachelor of Arts degrees, at 1952 University of Pittsburgh mid-year graduation, Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall
CatSubject_tab: Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Group portraits--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Graduates--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall (Pittsburgh, Pa.)
